did.unittitle: Scrapbook collection
did.abstract: Collection consists of scrapbooks, containing clippings, broadsides, manuscripts, portraits, photographs, and ephemera covering a variety of subjects, including the death of Edward VIII, Giuseppe Garibaldi, Southern California politics, Starege McCanless Swineford, Thomas Hardy, World War I, the Boer War, and the Spanish-American War.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Scrapbook Collection (Collection 155). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by UCLA Library Special Collections staff.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of scrapbooks, containing clippings, broadsides, manuscripts, portraits, photographs, and ephemera covering a variety of subjects, including the death of Edward VIII, Giuseppe Garibaldi, Southern California politics, Starege McCanless Swineford, Thomas Hardy, World War I, the Boer War, and the Spanish-American War.

did.unittitle: Scrapbook no. 1: Overman Mining Company, San Francisco

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings concerning the Overman Mining Company and the Sutro Tunnel taken chiefly from San Francisco newspapers

did.unittitle: Scrapbook no. 2: Jarboe and Harrison, Attorneys at law, San Francisco

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings from San Francisco newspapers concerning opinions delivered by various national and California State courts in regard to land titles in California. Alphabetical index in manuscript precedes clippings. Marked: Miscellaneous No. 2

did.unittitle: Scrapbook no. 3: The Ralston Memorial, San Francisco.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook of clippings concerning the career and death of William C. Ralston (1826 - 1875). Prepared by A. Stein

did.unittitle: Scrapbook no. 4: Simpson, Mary Jane. Sundries [and] original matter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook compiled by Mary Jane Simpson, the San Francisco Chronicle's correspondent for Virginia City and the Washoe Mines. Contains her articles and additional material taken from S.F. and V.C. newspapers. Incl. W.C.Ralston letter (3/13/1871)

did.unittitle: Scrapbook no. 5: Bigelow, Henry H.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook containing clippings, broadsides and manuscripts relating to the insurance business in California and the United States, compiled by HHB, general manager of the San Francisco office of Home Mutual Ins. Co. and agent for Pacific Ins. Co.

did.unittitle: Scrapbook no. 6: Bornholm, bombardment of

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Gummed stub file containing printed specifications issued by the Chief Engineer of the State Board of Harbor Commissioners for work to be done at San Francisco Harbor. Many specifications issued by Marsden Manson (1850 - 1931), Chief Engineer

did.unittitle: Scrapbook no. 11 vols. 1, 2: Kalloch - DeYoung, DeYoung - Kalloch shootings and trial

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Charles DeYoung (1845 - 1880) shot San Francisco mayorial candidate Isaac Smith Kalloch (1832 - 1890) on Aug. 23, 1879,and was himself killed by the mayor's son Isaac M. Kalloch (1853 - ) on Apr. 24, 1880. Robert E. Cowan collection

did.unittitle: Scrapbook no. 25: California State Supreme Court

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
